intro: Desmazeria compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf desmazeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, compressed leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
